Implement Database Performance Optimizations
description:
Optimize SQLite database operations for high-volume production use. Current implementation may have performance bottlenecks under load that need addressing.

Key areas for optimization:
- Query performance for large event databases
- Index optimization for common filter patterns
- Connection pooling and transaction management
- Batch event operations and bulk inserts
- Memory usage optimization for concurrent operations
- Event cleanup and retention policies
- Backup and database maintenance strategies

This ensures relay can handle production traffic loads efficiently without performance degradation.

title: Phase 3: Add Advanced Features & Production Monitoring
description:
Implement advanced relay features for production deployment including enhanced authentication, comprehensive monitoring, payment-based access, and advanced abuse detection. This brings the relay to full production-ready state with enterprise-level capabilities.

Key components needed:
- Enhanced NIP-42 authentication with persistent state management
- Payment-based access control (optional, for premium features)
- Comprehensive metrics collection and health endpoints
- Advanced abuse detection using ML/heuristics
- A/B testing framework for policy evaluation
- Resource usage quotas and limits
- Search optimization and indexing improvements
- Backup and disaster recovery mechanisms
- Administrative interfaces for relay management
- Performance profiling and optimization tools

This addresses the advanced features needed for enterprise-level relay deployment and makes the system production-ready for high-traffic scenarios.

title: Design and Implement Central Configuration System
description:
Create a comprehensive configuration system that supports all the new features across Phase 1-3. This config system will be the foundation for managing rate limits, content policies, authentication settings, and feature flags.

Key components needed:
- YAML/JSON configuration file structure
- Environment variable support
- Hot-reloading of configuration changes
- Validation and default value handling
- Separate config sections for rate limiting, content policies, authentication, monitoring
- Backward compatibility with current command-line flags
- Configuration schema validation

This provides a centralized way to manage all production relay settings without code changes.

title: Phase 1: Add Basic Protection (Rate Limiting & Connection Management)
description:
Implement rate limiting and connection management to prevent spam and DoS attacks. This is critical before any public deployment.

Key components needed:
- Rate limiting per IP and global (EVENT, REQ, connection limits)
- Connection pool management with max connections per IP
- Event size validation and frequency controls
- Configurable limits via config file
- Rate limiter state management

This addresses the most critical security gap in current implementation.

title: Phase 2: Add Content Management & Basic Moderation
description:
Implement content filtering and moderation policies to handle spam, illegal content, and abuse. This makes the relay suitable for public use by adding content validation, spam detection, and basic moderation capabilities.

Key components needed:
- Content validation filters (spam patterns, keywords, size limits)
- Event size and frequency restrictions
- Basic spam detection algorithms
- Content categorization and filtering
- NIP-52 moderation event support
- Blocklist/unblocklist functionality for IPs and pubkeys
- Configurable content policies via config file
- Event expiration handling for old/irrelevant content

This addresses content safety and spam prevention for production environment.

title: Add Production Logging and Health Endpoints
description:
Implement comprehensive logging, health check endpoints, and metrics collection for production monitoring. This is foundational for observability and troubleshooting in production deployments.

Key components needed:
- Structured logging (JSON format with levels)
- Health check endpoint (/health) for monitoring systems
- Metrics endpoint (/metrics) for Prometheus/Grafana
- Performance counters (events/second, connection counts, error rates)
- Request/response logging with correlation IDs
- Log rotation and retention policies
- Error tracking and alerting integration
- Memory and resource usage tracking
- Request latency histograms

This provides essential observability needed for production relay operations.
